page.title: 05A Fright at the Pub.
page.content: The window shattered, letting in the screaming wind. He ran for the door, groping frantically for the handle. He turned it,the door did not open, it seemed to be locked. He ran to the window, then realised that a fifty foot drop onto concrete would be worse than remaining in the room. Or would it? He remembered reading a brass plate in the wall of the tavern which said 'The Red Bedroom is said to be haunted by a mad poltergeist which was encounted by King George V when he slept at the Inn. He had laughed at the time, but now he was terrified. Suddenly he saw a pair of red eyes gleaming in the darkness. The blood pounded through his temples, he screamed, and blacked out.{ { James Farebrother.
